website_summaries.verdict: If rubber tires are important to you, you'll want to check out this Schwinn balance bike.
pros: Weight and frame feel more like a real bike
Air tires and tubes give better traction than plastic wheels
cons: Too heavy for toddlers, but a good weight for preschoolers

customer_reviews.title: Seat broke off.
customer_reviews.text: This bike has been great, but right after the year mark the seat broke off during regular use by my skinny 3-year-old. I contacted Schwinn and it's outside of their 1-year warranty so they were going to charge $14.95 plus shipping and tax to replace the under-engineered part. I found this:  on amazon for under $13, free shipping, and it's metal framework, so it should hold up way better. It looks slightly big on the bike, but works great for my son and fits perfectly on the post.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Love it, and Schwinn took care of us when something broke 5 months in. Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I can honestly say it’s a solid bike... in spite of 5 months later when plastic seat mount broke... I emailed a couple of pictures to Schwinn (googled their warranty info) and within 24 hours they reviewed it and said I would see a new seat and pole mount within the next week at my doorstep. Our 3 year old son rides around our big yard on it every day. I can’t ask for more in a kids’ bike or manufacturer warranty than that!!!
customer_reviews.author: MO folk

customer_reviews.title: The bike is great - AFTER we took it to our local bike ...
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great - AFTER we took it to our local bike shop and paid $20 to get it put together. Once we saw how to do it, we probably could have done it ourselves but the instructions were absolutely useless. Hopefully the following will be helpful: the additional nut needed for the front tire is encased in the black plastic piece, you have to break the plastic piece to get it out. Also remove the plastic cap from the handlebar piece in order to fit it correctly into the body of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine C. Van Horn

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any toddler!
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend! My 2.5 year old mastered this bike only a month after getting it. Absolutely great purchase. *Don't forget a helmet!* For reference, he's 36.5" tall and the seat is raised almost half way up. So this would fit a smaller toddler no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: 2.5 year old loves it!
customer_reviews.text: MY 2.5 year old said on the first try "it's too hard." He is used to going fast and zooming around on his ifly bike. By the next day he was more confident and a couple weeks in and we have to ask him not too go down the hill in our backyard with it. He got the hang of it real quick. He's able to go fast on it now and it's definitely preparing him for the real wheel pedal bike. He understands the weight/balance and can counterbalance while on it now. FYI: The wheels are plastic not rubber.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks B.

customer_reviews.title: Cute little balance bike
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy this balance bike over a Strider because of the wheels. I did not want to get plastic wheels because they just feel unsafe to me when riding on cement because of the lack of grip. This bike was also a better deal than a Strider. My little peanut of a three-year-old is just a little too short for this yet (he got it for Christmas and turned three a week later) but I have confidence that he will be able to fit on it better by this summer. I'm excited for him to actually be able to ride it!
customer_reviews.author: Holly W.

customer_reviews.title: Seat stem too long.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 2 year old birthday. Cute bike. Very sturdy. Looks like it will last. Bike is heavy for a 2 year old. If it starts to fall over it is too heavy for a toddler to hold up. Also, the seat is very high even at the lowest point. Had to take the seat off for him to be able to touch the floor, and then pad the stem. He is average height. This bike is rated for a lot younger than 2, but no way will it fit. I would give him another 6 months before he can sit on the seat and put both feet on the floor. The seat stem is too long.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly W

customer_reviews.title: Great bike to learn with
customer_reviews.text: We got this bike for my two year old for Christmas. She is pretty petite so the seat is at the lowest setting. She can stand pretty flat footed when she had shoes on but because she tends to be barefoot a lot (her choice not mine) so she walks around with it while on her tippy toes most of the time. The color is beautiful. The build is sturdy without being heavy. She plays with it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Brii

customer_reviews.title: Great size for a 3 year old's first bike.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice starter bike for my son. He loves it. I was a bit upset that the bike came out of the packaging with some minor blemishes to the paint from shipping. I was able to move a sticker it came with to hide the worst one, but I'm sure he'll get plenty of scratches on it over time, so I'm not that worried about it. It just would have been nice to give him it without any scratches as it was his first bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my grandson as a Christmas gift and what a great purchase this was, he is only two and this is really helped him keep and maintain his balance. This is a good bike to help train kids to be ready for a bigger bike. My grandson really enjoys being pushed around. High quality bike easy to put together quick and fast shipment.
customer_reviews.author: John J Cattolico

customer_reviews.title: Seat broke after minimal use
customer_reviews.text: This bike is only a few months old, used by a small girl who only used her feet to straddle the bike & never sit down. Now she sits down & knows how to use the bike properly. The seat broke. How do we get the seat or bike replaced?
customer_reviews.author: V. Tadlock

customer_reviews.title: He does his best, and soon enough he will be tall enough
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his new bike. The height of the seat, even at the lowest setting, was still too high for him. He's a big two year old. I thought I read that the bike was from 18 mo to 3 years. I would say it's probably more for 2.5 - 4 year old's only because they wouldn't be able to reach the ground with their legs if seated on the bike seat. Regardless, he loves it. He does his best, and soon enough he will be tall enough.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa and J

customer_reviews.title: Working on teaching my 3 year old how to ride ...
customer_reviews.text: Working on teaching my 3 year old how to ride. I looked up how to ride on youtube and think that would have been helpful information to have initially, but the info is out there for how to teach them. Basically just have them walk with their legs on either side at first and as they get better/more coordinated they start going faster and eventually sit down and ride it. We haven't made it to the sit down and ride yet, but are getting there.
customer_reviews.author: JPalmer

customer_reviews.title: A Very nice balance bike
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a very well made bike, that should last my son for several years. It is a decent size and can grow with him. The downside is it's a little big for him just yet, (just over 2 years old now) so he can just barely put his feet down while sitting on the seat. That's ok though. Im sure he'll grow into it by summer. I like that the Schwinn has real tires vs foam rubber, and it's made just like a regular bike, in a small form factor. Initial quality seems very good. Ours was packed well and undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves this thing!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my two year old grandson who took to it like a duck to water. Never been on a bike before but he picked it up in about 5 minutes. I'm sure he'll become aware of balance as time goes by. The inflatable tires alone give it a superior quality and feel over most of the competition and the frame construction is heavy duty. Only issue is if the child has less than a 12" inseam it will be a little difficult to use properly but he/she will grow in to it as time goes by. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this bike to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Quaudi

customer_reviews.title: Glider bikes are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my son's fourth birthday, and was a little worried he'd be too tall (he's average height). But the seat adjusts and it Is fine. He was having trouble with pedals on other bikes, so he would forget to steer. The balance bike has been extremely helpful getting his head up from his feet and on the road/trail ahead. His balance and gliding is really great, and our hope is to bypass training wheels. However, It makes mom a little nervous going down even very gradual hills ;) so we limit it to our local walking trails and other flat places!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Gruskowski Chilcote

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a good entry level learning bike, look no further. It was easy to setup, and arrived quickly. You don’t really need any tools to get it together. There is a quick release for the seat height adjustment. The wheels seem to be aligned pretty well. The cost is right and the quality of the product is good. My son is happy with it and always wants to take it everywhere. Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: Eric B

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my almost 3yr old daughter because my son has one (different brand) that she uses really well and needed her own. This one is a lot heavier than my sons but it is really sturdy and appears to be high quality, it’s just unfortunate because these bikes are meant for smaller kids so I didn’t think there’d be that much of a weight difference. My son usually rides this one now while my daughter is in his, although after about a month of practice she can ride the Schwinn one a bit better.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: the bike looks nice but it didn't work out for my Daughter
customer_reviews.text: the bike looks nice but it didn't work out for my Daughter. as few other people mention they deisgn the foot rest in the wrong place she kept getting caught by it and couldn't balance her self. she play with it a few time and give up. If i had to make the decision again I would buy a bike with training wheel instead. another note for the price we paid around $50, we got a 16inch bike with training wheel for only 38 dollar when it went on sale. she like it much more than this balance bike.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old's birthday, and it's super sturdy with an easy-to-adjust seat. My 7 year old niece has ridden around on it (standing on the frame) a couple of times and it has held up just fine. My daughter is starting to get the hang of it after having it for a few months now, she wasn't terribly interested at first, but now that she's seen her cousins going fast on their bikes I think she'll be racing around after them in no time.
customer_reviews.author: KitVonDTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Seat broke in less than 6 months
customer_reviews.text: The bottom of the seat is plastic and attached to the seat post with a screw. My son only gets to ride the bike once or twice a week and that plastic broke right through. So the bike is now useless without a seat. It’s too bad because it looks nice and my son loved it. He was really learning how to balance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing valve stem caps.
customer_reviews.text: Missing valve stem caps which seems to be a common issue on the reviews. Seems Amazon/Schwinn didn’t care about containing and correcting that issue. It’s frustrating given the $$ spent on the bike, and there is no good way to contact anyone to correct the problem by simply sending sending two caps no charge. Also, what is the flimsy wrap around the middle of the handle bars supposed to do? Was there supposed to be a foam LV to prevent head bumps on the handle bars?
customer_reviews.author: JMac

customer_reviews.title: Tires are awful and won't hold air
customer_reviews.text: I received first version of the bike. No caps for valves, but ok, my kid is not riding an Ironman so who cares. Bigger issue, front tire won't hold air. Order replacement, it arrives, same issue. Now, I have done my fair share of road and tri biking so I know how to troubleshoot a flat...the inner tubes were damaged on both bikes! Had to send them back and find a different bike.
customer_reviews.author: RVM

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as shown
customer_reviews.text: This bike is exactly as described. We had no issues w/ parts as some other reviews stated. This is high quality we have noticed no rust or wear on color. Easy adjustment as child grows. Just wish there was an add pedal option as we are now ready for a real bike.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Our four year old LOVES this. It literally took ...
customer_reviews.text: Our four year old LOVES this. It literally took him less than 30 minutes to start balancing. Our third time out someone actually commented how his balance skills would put the bigger kids to shame!! Its been about three months and he can (somewhat) keep up with me when I am on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: RMDC

customer_reviews.title: Real air tires. Great for gravel
customer_reviews.text: We live outside of town, so no sidewalks to ride on. Only gravel road so I was pleased to find a balance bike that didn't have solid foam tires. My 2 year old LOVES it. Especially because it's metal just like his big brothers. Quality is superb and seems like it will last for years even with rough use and getting left in the yard way too often. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner bike
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves this bike. She has been riding it on an almost daily basis since August. Sturdy product and great for riding around indoors or outdoors. Tires are not inflatable, they are made of some type of foam, so they don’t scuff up wood floors and seem to hold up well riding around on concrete. If you are looking for a balance bike, you can’t be the price and good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Teaching Bike
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (3 years Old) learend how to balance, push and coast in 1 day. This was an excellent learning bike and she already wants to get a pedal bike when she grows a couple of more inches.
customer_reviews.author: jbon

customer_reviews.title: Bought this bike for our 2 year old. Adjust ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for our 2 year old. Adjust the seat and the seat itself broke. Not worth shipping back to Amazon so now I have to figure out how to fix the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Levi

customer_reviews.title: Big help in learning to ride.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 3 1/2 grandson to use at my house. He also has a bike at home with training wheels but doesn't have a good area to ride on so it's hard for his parents to help him learn to ride. He was excited to try the balance bike as soon as he saw it but he didn't understand what to do. His grandmother got out the iPad and showed him a youtube video. When he got back on the balance bike he took off and within a few minutes he was trying to glide with his feet up. We think this will be a big help in learning to ride without the training wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Charles C

customer_reviews.title: Great little balance bike
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little balance bike that I purchased for my 2 year old grandson. It is sturdy, lightweight, and well built. It arrived packaged very well with no scratches, however, it was missing valve caps for the tires. I’m hoping I can find those easily at Walmart. Except for the missing valve caps, I am very happy with this purchase and recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Add the right allen wrench & it’s great
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good little bike, what you’d expect in the price range, however, I don’t think it would cost the company too much to throw in the right allen wrench and better instructions. If you don’t have the right size tool on hand the bike won’t be safe or functional whether your kid already saw it or not. Frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: KMikaela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect beginner bike
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bike for my 2.5 yr old and he mastered it no time. He asks everyday to ride his bike. I love that the tires are actually air filled rubber tires compared to most other balance bikes. Great quality bike. My only complaint is that the Schwinn emblem below the handle bars is just a metal sticker basically, and doesn’t stay. It’s peeling off and exposes a sharp edge .
customer_reviews.author: KaraG

customer_reviews.title: Great bike, has held up through three boys
customer_reviews.text: All three of our sons have used this bike. None of them are at all gentle with it, and it's been left out in the rain quite a few times. Our oldest in particular loved it and rode miles and miles on it. The bike is still sturdy, shiny, and great. Two of the boys learned to ride a regular bike in a day, both before their fourth birthdays. (The youngest is still only two and is using the balance bike now.)
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Pink Bike
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bike for my daughter so she could be more active and work on her balance skills. The bike was easy to assemble for the most part, I feel the directions could have been a little more specific . Like how to tighten the steering wheel. The bike is great and well made. The adjustable seat is great and is all the way down for my daughter who is 3ft. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Size is not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The bike was too high for my son who is 2.5-year-old and his feet couldn't touch the ground when he got on the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur S

customer_reviews.title: Seat adjusting handle snapped off
customer_reviews.text: I’m so disappointed. I had this stored from July til December in the box the way it comes. It was a Christmas gift (i do all my shopping early). I was adjusting the seat two days after assembly and the handle snapped off so now I won’t be able to adjust the seat in the future when my son needs it raised. I’m so disappointed about this because we are super excited for his first bike.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Tires not fill able !!!
customer_reviews.text: I love the colors of this bike it is sturdy and lightweight and was easy to put together however in description it says the tires are real tillable tires and they are not. There is no platform for the feet like it shows in the description. Bummer really a lot of money wasted.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Great glider
customer_reviews.text: Got this to relive a radio flyer where the handlebars didn’t tighten and the seat kept sliding down. Lent the extra money on this guy with no regrets. Feels solid handlebars stay. Boy loves it. Wish it came with a bell, but that was easy enough to fix
customer_reviews.author: Dantes

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE REPACKED BIKE
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE BIKE!!! IT WAS A BIRTHDAY GIFT FOR MY THREE YEARS OLD NEPHEW IN NC!!! IT CAME WITH MANY SCRATCHES ON IT!!! THE FRONT WEAL IT WAS CRAKED!!! LOOKS LIKE SOMEONE ELSE USED IT AND YOU GUYS JUST REPACKED IT!!! THIS IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE !!! VERY MAD AT THIS WHOLE SITUATION!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Damir

customer_reviews.title: This bike is so much fun to ride that our six-year-old keeps stealing it from ...
customer_reviews.text: We got this balance bike for our two-year-old for Christmas so that he could get a start on bike riding. We did the whole training wheels thing with our older son and were unimpressed, so we went the balance route for our younger son. This bike is so much fun to ride that our six-year-old keeps stealing it from his baby brother! The seat is adjustable and should be good for any 2-3 year old, but the seat can go up high enough that a 6-year-old​, while not the main audience, can still have some fun on his brother's toy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel & Kara Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Broken Seat...very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bike about two months ago and were really pleased with the quality....until the seat snapped off!!! Very disappointing because I can't find a replacement seat for this particular bike. You can see from the picture that it snapped off inside the seat because it is plastic (cheap). Really disappointed. For our older child we actually bought a Price Lionheart wooden balance bike off Amazon that held up for two years with heavy, heavy use. I was expecting more from this bike...
customer_reviews.author: Nick Daise

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and well made.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful bike, but too tall for my almost 3-year-old, and he's tall for his age. We had to return it for a shorter one. Amazon processed the return quickly, with no hassles. Very satisfied with products and service!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: This is a great way to learn how to ride without worrying about ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 year old loves it. This is a great way to learn how to ride without worrying about pedaling. Kids can learn to balance and get comfortable on a bike by scooting along and not relying on training wheels or adding the sometimes frustrating pedaling. Once they master this, simply add pedals and go. My nephew had a different brand and learned to ride this way. He is now 4 and rides like a champ. I couldn't get my daughter on bike because she was frustrated with the pedaling and always felt like she was falling over. Now she scoots along in the house and outside. Sometimes I'll have her prop her feet up on the platform and push her.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my granddaughter. It was shipped to them so I didn't have a chance to see it. My son was impressed by how well it was made. It was just like a good quality child's bike, made as a balance bike. It rides well, and she's enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: sbdme

customer_reviews.title: Great bike for price
customer_reviews.text: Instructions weren’t 100% clear but I figured it out. Great balance bike for the price. My four year old loves it. He’s 36 inches tall and sides with the seat about 1 inch higher than the lowest setting. He just walked with it at first while sitting on it but now he’s built up the courage to push and go a little faster. I like the fact that it has a little ledge to put your feet up when cruising along.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Good balance bike, but kinda a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Schinn balance bike is ok, but I think it's a waste of money. The kid uses a balance bike foe a few months then they need a pedal bike with training wheels. I think the pedals are hardest thing to accomplish on a bike. This balance bike is pretty good. It was easy to put together, light weight, and my 4yo got it in a couple days.
customer_reviews.author: SheliaM86

customer_reviews.title: Very well made toddler bike
customer_reviews.text: A very well made bike for a toddler. Easy to put together. Much more sturdy than other models. Tires are are like a heavy duty foam rather than rubber. Good handle grips. Adjustable seat which is easy to move.
customer_reviews.author: steelwidow

customer_reviews.title: Good bike but arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for my 23 month old twins. They arrived on time and seem really sturdy. They are just a tiny bit too small for the kiddos but they will grow into it in no time. My only complaint is that blue bike came in with a long slit in the front tire making it unusable. Because we wanted to give these to the kids at the same time my husband went up to Walmart and spent the twenty bucks to replace the tire. But it seems like quality control should have caught it pretty easily so I’m taking a couple stars away.
customer_reviews.author: Jenni irby

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily only within a few days.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter and only after a week of minimal use, the seat broke. Seat broke off of post, and cannot be mounted back on without it either coming back off, or swiveling side to side. You would think this type of thing would happen months or even years of wear, not within just a few days. Going to see if it can be returned without original box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 10 day Prime delivery & after Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Cute bike, well made & was thrilled that it didn't have the plastic tires. The seat is quite a bit higher than many of the other balance bikes but my husband can fix that & this one is better made. HOWEVER my complaint was with the seller.. was supposed to be a 2 day Prime. I ordered it on Dec 16 & received it the day AFTER Christmas... Thanks for that!
customer_reviews.author: xrazer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up. It's super useful for kids to learn to balance. I had my doubts but saw other reviews. My 5 yr old daughter learned riding her bike quick, within a month, using the balance bike.
customer_reviews.author: LuvAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Super cute and Perfect size for 2-4 year olds
customer_reviews.text: Great first balance bike for my two year old son! He loves it and it is sooooo cute and great quality. Love the real tires and it looks like a BMX or hot wheels bike. Super cute and functional. Just buy it
customer_reviews.author: Jud

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had purchased this sooner
customer_reviews.text: I waited too long to order this. My granddaughter is too tall for it. (She is 6.) She has tried it and I think it has helped her get closer to being confident on her regular bicycle. Her younger sister will make better use of it. It is well made, durable and very easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: Donna K. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike, disipointed in condition upon delivery.
customer_reviews.text: While the bike itself is nice, we are a little disappointed that it arrived with several scratches and dings as well as a deep gouge on the front handle bar bolt that required filing and touch up painting. Our bike also arrived with missing tire stem caps! Our purchase is a birthday gift which doesn’t allow for exchange time so we’ve repaired and will be purchasing the missing items which is frustrating when you’ve paid for a new item.
customer_reviews.author: LV Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Easy and well made
customer_reviews.text: This bike was so easy to put together and is a very well made! My husband ordered this because he had seen one of our friends little boys zooming around on one however our almost two year is going to need a little more practice before he really gets going on it. It is pretty heavy so it's difficult for my little guy to keep it up so he can even get into the seat, but the fact that's it's weighty makes me feel that it is a high quality product that will withstand little boy shenanigans when he does get the hang of it.
customer_reviews.author: Mase&Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Love the bike except.....
customer_reviews.text: The bike is heavy and well made. My daughter absolutely loves it. I love everything about it except 2 things: one— that the adjustable seat does not stay up, so we have to constantly raise it up again (we’re talking approximately every 15 minutes of use), and two— the left rubber handle grip slides off every time she rides it. For the price, I would’ve thought the bike would’ve not had these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good balance bike, but needs better assembly instructions
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a birthday present for our 3-year-old. Some notes: - The paint quality is "just ok". It's probably going to get scuffed up anyway, but even assembling it I put a few dings in it. - The directions included are downright poor. It's a one-page document with 9 or 10 steps in very small font. Not very helpful. - A crescent wrench is the only tool I used to put the bike together. That was nice. - My daughter loves it! So, overall a win. It think it's a decent value and a solid 4-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Craig L.

customer_reviews.title: flat tire
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 3 stars because for some reason the back tire is flat and the bike has not been used at all since i got it. It has just been put together. Not sure where I can get another tube, but it would've been nice if the tires could hold air
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Good bike!
customer_reviews.text: Super cute bike. Bought for our 2 year old for her birthday. She is 34 inches tall and her tip toes barely touch the ground with the seat in the lowest position.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Welding inspector dropped the ball
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike for my granddaughters birthday and out of the box it looks like a beautiful bike. It was easy to assemble. Paint is good but the welds look awful. It’s like something I had done when I was 12 years old and learning how to weld. Not smooth, had a hole in the weld at the joining of the parts. Not up to the Schwinn quality I grew up with. The seat looks woefully under engineered. She’s a little girl, so we’ll see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: James I. Fleshman

customer_reviews.title: Product as described
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sturdy well built inflatable tires Easy to assemble Seat adjust easy Cons: Not meant for toddlers under 36"
customer_reviews.author: Gigi from El Paso, Texas

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Tires
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 3 year old grand daughter. We tried two previous ones but they both had plastic tires and it kept slipping out from under her (which made her a bit scared of it). Once we found this one, the first one had one tire that wouldn't hold any air so we returned it and the second one works great. Very good quality & well made. We are glad we purchased it and would buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J.

customer_reviews.title: Front Wheel Bearings Broke After 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: After 2 months of use by my 3 and 5 year old sons, the front wheel bearings fell out onto the ground making it impossible to ride the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Christiansen

customer_reviews.title: Made in China and it shows
customer_reviews.text: I thought Schwinn was supposed to be top notch. The welds were left with burrs that were super sharp. And half of the stickers were falling off. Very disappointed in this made in China pos.
customer_reviews.author: unionmoe

customer_reviews.title: All kids should start out on one of these!
customer_reviews.text: This balance bike is the best ever! Our 3 year old granddaughter loves it. This one is nice because it has the foot rests on the sides. She has learned to be comfortable and confident balancing on this and will be riding her bigger bike with no training wheels in no time. This is the perfect bike for tots to start off with.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jose

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: My son really enjoys this bike! It's very well built as in sturdy and the ergonomics are right on. But the inner tubes where pretty cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Erick/Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great features, great value!
customer_reviews.text: We love this bike. For twice the price, we could have purchased one whose sit goes a little lower for a little younger crowd (it's a little tall for 2-year-olds), but we just couldn't spend that much money! We also wanted the inflatable rubber tires, knowing that we'll have 3 kids learning to ride on this thing. Plastic tires break WAY too fast. We love the foot rest for giving kids balance practice. The Schwinn is just like the more expensive Giant, aside from that seat; definitely a worthwhile purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah S

customer_reviews.title: High hopes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's second birthday. Geez, how do you get your kid to try new things? It took me weeks just to get her to sit on the darn thing! She still won't ride it, or scoot on it, without me holding on plus tons of encouragement. I chose this model in particular because I trust Schwinn, I wanted the little foot ledge, and because of the great tires. I have high hopes that this will get her riding a bicycle in record time.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Lynn

customer_reviews.title: poor design. - The FORK had trouble staying in ...
customer_reviews.text: Two stars off for two big problems: - The SEAT snapped off at the cheap plastic base and there is no way to fix it. Cheap, poor design. - The FORK had trouble staying in alignment and required somewhat regular adjustment/tightening so that the tire stayed perpendicular to the handlebars. Otherwise, the frame and tires are GREAT! I highly recommend a balance bike for building up these skills.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My Granddaughter loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bike for my 3 year old granddaughter. It's a good fit for her size and should last. She loves the pink color as well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Shipped from Amazon with broken and missing parts.
customer_reviews.text: Shipped from Amazon with broken and missing parts. So giant #Fail for Christmas. WSJ article about "are you buying trash from Amazon" turned out to be true.
customer_reviews.author: GeoF

customer_reviews.title: And away she goes
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 4 yr old granddaughter. She did an awesome job riding it for the first time. She was able to balance the bike very easily. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Grammy of 2

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bike
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old LOVES his bike! Perfect fit for him too. I feel confident he will be able to pedal with out training wheels next year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality balance bike
customer_reviews.text: Good quality balance bike. We had to lower it a little for our 2 yr old son to ride on it. He is 35" (80. Percentile) and it was still to big for him to reach the bottom with his feet flat to ride it nicely. He just started riding it. It takes some time to get used to it and until they figure out how it works and then they are all over the place. If you have small/petite children this bike probably won't fit when you want it to fit.
customer_reviews.author: Meike LoRe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent balance bike
customer_reviews.text: Excellent balance bike. We were interested in this one and the Strider bike. This bike is a bit heavier I think but my 3 year old can pick it up and ride it easily. He will not go back in the stroller anymore but will ride this thing everywhere we go. It's holding up well - paint job is beautiful and the seat adjustment has been easy and fits my son's height (35 inches) perfectly. Love, love, love this bike!!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome balance bike for a great price
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike! My daughter zooms around the backyard all day on it. The pneumatic tires have great traction and look cool.
customer_reviews.author: cody saarloos

customer_reviews.title: Gateway for kids lacking confidence of biking without training wheels..
customer_reviews.text: Even though the bike is smaller for my 5 year old, he loves it. Because he gaining confidence to balance himself and enjoys riding without adult support or training wheels. He is getting sense of balance and enjoying the freedom. I thought initially this would be bad purchase but I was tempted when I saw it was only sale. It was a quick 5 min setup time for handle bar and seat. Now my son wants to ride every opportunity he gets. I couldn't be more happier with this bike. So it was win-win for me.
customer_reviews.author: Raj G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 3 year old!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my three year old for Christmas and he loves it! It was the first present he ran to. The bike seat works perfectly at the lowest setting for him and he will get plenty of years out of this bike. It is a gorgeous green color and not as neon looking as it is in the picture. It is a very sturdy and well made bike. My three year old is mastering it very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Awesome beginner bike
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was not easy for someone who is not mechanically inclined. I called my dad and he helped me get it together. My 2.5 yr old loves the bike and has a ton of fun on it. It is heavy but really sturdy. Definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JK218

customer_reviews.title: Cute bike
customer_reviews.text: Love this bike. It arrived quickly and was delivered on a Sunday morning! The bike was packaged neatly and set up easy with just the basic tools. My girl loves it though she's still a little small to use it on her own (16 months). Looking forward to watching her grow into it. It had none of the flaws described by other reviews and was rust free. The bike is quite heavy but feels very solid. Seems built to last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson he has visited twice and while ridding it the 2nd time the handle bars will not turn. my husband tried fixing it and said the parts are stripped. very sad for my 3 year old grandson... just out the window for returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Tasi

customer_reviews.title: Well, I didn't really get a Schwinn Balance Bike
customer_reviews.text: What I got was a toddler 6v quad, My granddaughter loves it! (Someone out there knew better than I what she really wanted. LOL) The price was about the same as I ordered the Schwinn on the Cyber Monday sales. I will more than likely reorder the Schwinn at a later date, winter in Michigan! Bought one years ago, not a Schwinn but nice and the kid loved it. Hardest thing was teaching him to peddle after he was big enough for a real bike.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Paul

customer_reviews.title: we bought this bike in green four years ago for ...
customer_reviews.text: we bought this bike in green four years ago for my daughter. it has done her so well, we just ordered this second one in red for her two year old brother. it is a heavy duty bike, which is what we need bc we live in rural montana. gravel, mountains, dirt, rocks, big rocks. the bike is heavy so works well in these conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn R Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Tires are cheap
customer_reviews.text: The body of the bike is really nice, but the plastic tires make it very slippery for my child. If you live in a place where it constantly rains and snow not the best fit unless you plan to swap it out for rubber tires.
customer_reviews.author: Poy

customer_reviews.title: Great bike
customer_reviews.text: Nice balance bike, I bought one for my grandson for his second birthday. He loves it and has really learned to balance well. He rides it down small hills now with his feet up. Made very sturdy. Easy to put together also.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and sturdy bike! For a just turned 3 yr old boy, that is on the smaller side of the charts, took him a little bit to get the hang of it but he loved it so much he kept trying! The seat adjusts lower that what he needed and he is short so I was surprised it went that low.
customer_reviews.author: CandyInGB

customer_reviews.title: Seat broke within 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: We will absolutely be returning this bike as fast as it came. Within 5 minutes of my son riding it the seat broke and he fell off backwards, hurting his arm. The seat is very cheaply made unlike the rest of the bike. Also, it came without the tire valve stem caps. Not a happy customer!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Very light and our 22m old can easily pick it up
customer_reviews.text: Our 4 year old was gliding within 2 days. She is a little big for it and likes the seat low, but we wanted something to get her started. She loves this bike. Very light and our 22m old can easily pick it up. He tries to ride it all the time, but he isn’t quite tall enough.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: Made in China = poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Made in China junk. Tire bowed first time we blew it up. It was my daughter’s 3rd birthday gifts and it was very disappointing to us. It scratches easily too and bell hardly stays on. It is not the sturdy, well made Schwinn I had as a child! Why why why did you make your bikes crap by letting them get made in China!!!??
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts!
customer_reviews.text: The bike is great however I am missing one bolt, the washer and hook for the front tire. And I cannot determine how to call and get the missing parts.
customer_reviews.author: Jameta

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate Owner's Manual
customer_reviews.text: The bike is good and my son likes it, but the assembly instructions are terribly inaccurate. It's shocking this has the "Schwinn" brand name given the inadequacy of the owner's manual. Minus 1 star for inadequate manual.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: I purchased a bike that relatively expensive for your children ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a bike that relatively expensive for your children and after a while the chair breaks down and there is no place to buy suitable chairs for bicycles. I've been looking for along time.
customer_reviews.author: Gonen H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike built well
customer_reviews.text: This works perfect for our 3/4 year old. He loves it and it is very strong and sturdy but light enough to get in and out of car easily.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Dell

customer_reviews.title: The kids love this bike!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3 year old niece. She absolutely loves it. I had previously bought one for my nephew, and it lasted him 3 years with daily use. He also loved this thing and called it his "Dirtbike". It helped with both of their balance without risking them not being able to stop with pedals. Great gift for ages 2.5-5
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: My kid really likes the bike but took awhile before she could use it because was pretty heavy
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: We received our bike with missing parts. We called Schwinn and they shipped the missing part to us in one week.
customer_reviews.author: Coral

customer_reviews.title: Great Balance Bike
customer_reviews.text: This bike is GREAT! As a 3 year old my son raced balance bikes (i know silly huh) and this bike help up on various BMX tracks throughout the state. The bike is still being rode by another child to this day! After having this bike for around two years, he learned how to ride a standard two wheel peddle bike in the matter on a half an hour. If you're on the fence about this bike, trust me, BUY IT.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Marie

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and as described. My little one is still just a tad too short to sit on the seat and reach the floor but he stands in from of the seat and walks with it through the house. So it's a start and soon will be really rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Klunk

customer_reviews.title: Good Bike, Broken Seat
customer_reviews.text: The bike seems to be good quality, however the seat post clamp was damaged when it arrived. The seat post is metal, but the seat is attached to the post with a plastic clamp that slips over the post and then a bolt slides through both the clamp and the post, locking them together. I have added photos showing where the plastic is broken. I am hoping you will send a replacement seat. The bike cannot be ridden without this issue being fixed because when sat on the seat flips backwards toward the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Schwinn Skip Toddler Balance Bike, 12-Inch Wheels, Beginner Rider Training, Multiple Colors
product_meta.description: The Schwinn Skip 1, 2, 3, and 4 is the ideal way for your little one to learn to ride and balance on a bike. When you were a kid, you had training wheels, got a good push and off you went. This method can still work, but balance bikes are designed to create balancing skills better than a tricycle can. Using a balance bike removes the need to pedal, teaching the child to push with their legs and glide, like using a seated scooter. Once they are old enough to ride a tricycle, they are old enough to get on a balance bike. You won't believe how fast they can go and how quickly they will learn to ride when introduced to a pedal bike! For such a simple bike, the Skip has great features, like a lightweight steel frame that's low enough for a child's foot to rest on the ground, a molded mag wheel with a 12-Inch tire, a steering limiter safety feature so the rider can't oversteer and a tool-free adjustable seat post. The Skip comes with a limited lifetime warranty for as long as you own the bike. Teach your little one to ride on a balance bike they'll love with the Skip by Schwinn.
feature_bullets: Lightweight steel foot-to-floor frame design is easy for young beginners to use
Designed with 12-inch wheels, this bike fits riders ages 2 to 4, or 28" to 38" in height
Easy steer handlebar with limiter make it easier for beginners to control the bike
Air filled tires provide a smooth ride while a lightweight mag wheel design adds style and flair
Tool-free adjustable seat post makes it easy to find a comfortable fit and includes a limited lifetime warranty for as long as you own the bike
